alert.note: Alert for North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 2:29AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Sioux County through 215 AM MDT... At 129 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Harrison, or 22 miles east of Lusk, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Sioux County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
